data.name: IslamInfo_AtTheStartOfPrayer1
data.value: O Allah, separate me from my sins as You have separated the East from the West. O Allah, cleanse me of my transgressions as the white garment is cleansed of stains. O Allah, wash away my sins with ice and water and frost.

data.name: IslamInfo_AtTheStartOfPrayer1WordByWord
data.value: O Allah,|separate|me|from|my sins|as|You have separated||the East|from the West.|O Allah,|cleanse me|of|my transgressions|as|is cleansed|the garment|white|of|stains.|O Allah,|wash|away|my sins|with ice|and water|and frost.

data.name: IslamInfo_AtTheStartOfPrayer2
data.value: Glory is to You, O Allah, and praise, Blessed is Your Name and Exalted is Your Majesty, There is none worthy of worship but You.

data.name: IslamInfo_AtTheStartOfPrayer2WordByWord
data.value: Glory is to You,|O Allah,|and praise,|Blessed is|Your Name|and Exalted|is Your Majesty,|There is none|worthy of worship|but You.

data.name: IslamInfo_AtTheStartOfPrayer3
data.value: I turn my face towards the One Who created the heavens and the earth, as a true believer. I am not of those who associate partners with Allah. Verily, my prayer and my devotion, my living and my death, are for Allah, Lord of the worlds, He has no partners. Thus I have been commanded and I am among those who have submitted. O Allah, You are the King, there is none worthy of worship but You. You are my Lord and I am Your slave. I have wronged my own soul and confess my sin. Forgive all of my sins, surely none forgives sins but You. Guide me to the perfection of my character, for none guides to its perfection but You. Protect me from the evils of my character, for none may protect me from its evils but You. I am here at Your service. All goodness is in Your Hands, and evil is not attributed to You. I am (created) by You, and I am (returning) to You. You are Most Blessed, Most Exalted. I seek Your forgiveness and repent to You.

data.name: IslamInfo_AtTheStartOfPrayer3WordByWord
data.value: I turn|my face|towards the One Who|created|the heavens|and the earth,|as a true believer.|not|I am|of those|who associate partners with Allah.|Verily,|my prayer|and my devotion,|my living|and my death,|are for Allah,|Lord|of the worlds,|no|partners|has He.|Thus|I have been commanded|and I am|among those who|have submitted.|O Allah,|You|are the King,|there is none|worthy of worship|but|You.|You|are my Lord|and I am|Your slave.|I have wronged|my own soul|and confess|my sin.|Forgive|me for|my sins|all of,|surely|none|forgives|sins|but|You.|Guide me|to the perfection|of my character,|for none|guides|to its perfection|but|You.|Protect|me from|the evils of my character,|for none|may protect|me from|its evils|but|You.|I am here|at Your service.|goodness|All|is in Your Hands,|and evil|is not attributed|to You.|I|am (created) by You|and I am (returning) to You.|You are Most Blessed,|Most Exalted.|I seek Your forgiveness|and repent|to You.

data.name: IslamInfo_AtTheStartOfPrayer4
data.value: O Allah, Lord of Jibra'il, Mika'il and Israfil. Maker of the heavens and the earth. Knower of the unseen and the seen. You judge between Your slaves regarding that in which they differ. Guide me to the truth regarding that in which there is difference, by Your Leave. Surely, You guide whomever you please to the straight path.

data.name: IslamInfo_AtTheStartOfPrayer4WordByWord
data.value: O Allah,|Lord|of Jibra'il,|Mika'il|and Israfil.|Maker of|the heavens|and the earth.|Knower of|the unseen|and the seen.|You|judge|between|Your slaves|that|regarding|in which|they differ.|Guide me|to that|there is difference regarding|in which|from|the truth,|by Your Leave.|Surely,|You guide||whomever you please|to|the straight|path.

data.name: IslamInfo_AtTheStartOfPrayer5
data.value: Allah is the Greatest, Most Great. Allah is the Greatest, Most Great. Allah is the Greatest, Most Great. Praise is to Allah, abundantly. Praise is to Allah, abundantly. Praise is to Allah, abundantly. Glory is to Allah, at the break of day and at its end. (3x). I seek refuge in Allah from Satan, From his breath and from his voice and from his whisper.

data.name: IslamInfo_AtTheStartOfPrayer5WordByWord
data.value: Allah|is the Greatest,|Most Great.|Allah|is the Greatest,|Most Great.|Allah|is the Greatest,|Most Great.|Praise|is to Allah,|abundantly.|Praise|is to Allah,|abundantly.|Praise|is to Allah,|abundantly.|Glory|is to Allah,|at the break of day|and at its end.|(3x)|I seek refuge|in Allah|from|Satan,|From|his breath|and from his voice|and from his whisper.

data.name: IslamInfo_AtTheStartOfPrayer6
data.value: O Allah, praise is to You. You are the light of the heavens and the earth and all that they contain. Praise is to You, You are the Sustainer of the heavens and the earth and all they contain. (Praise is to You, You are the Lord of the heavens and the earth and all they contain.) (Praise is to You, Yours is dominion of the heavens and the earth and all they contain.) (Praise is to You, You are the King of the heavens and the earth.) (And praise is to you.) (You are the truth, Your Promise is true, Your Word is true, Your audience is true, Paradise is true, Hell is true, the Prophets are true, and Muhammad (peace and blessings be upon him) is true, and the Hour of Judgement is true.) (O Allah, to You I have submitted, and upon You I depend. I have believed in You and to You I turn in repentence. For Your sake I dispute and by Your standard I judge. Forgive me what I have sent before me and what I have let behind me, what I have concealed and what I have declared.) (You are the One Who sends forth and You are the One Who delays, there is none who has the right to be worshipped but You.) (You are my God, there is none who has the right to be worshipped but You.)

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook1Chapter1
data.value: {How the Divine Inspiration started to be revealed to Allah's Messenger (SAWS). And the Statement of Allah (ta'ala): "Verily, We have inspired you (O Muhammad (SAWS)) as We inspired Nuh (Noah) and the Prophets after him."}4.163

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook20
data.value: Virtues of Prayer at Masjid Makkah and Madinah

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook27
data.value: Pilgrims Prevented from Completing the Pilgrimmage

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook28
data.value: Penalty of Hunting while on Pilgrimmage

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook2Chapter1
data.value: The statement of the Prophet (SAWS): 'Islam is based on five principles.'

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook2Chapter10
data.value: To love the Ansar is a sign of faith.

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook2Chapter12
data.value: To flee (run away) from Al-Fitan (trials and afflications etc.) is a part of religion.

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook2Chapter13
data.value: The statement of the Prophet (SAWS): 'I know Allah (azza wa jal) better than all of you do'.

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook2Chapter14
data.value: Whoever hates to revert to Kufr.

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook2Chapter15
data.value: The grades in superiority of the believers will be according to their good deeds.

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook2Chapter16
data.value: Al-Haya is a part of faith.

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook2Chapter17
data.value: The statement of Allah (azza wa jal): "But if they repent and perform Iqamat-as-Salat [offer Salat (prayers) perfectly] and give Zakat then leave their way free."

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook2Chapter18
data.value: Whoever says that faith is action (good deeds).

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook2Chapter19
data.value: If one does not embrace Islam truly, but does so by compulsion or for fear of being killed etc.

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook2Chapter20
data.value: To greet is a part of Islam.

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook2Chapter21
data.value: To be ungrateful to one's husband. And disbelief is of different grades.

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook2Chapter22
data.value: Sins are from ignorance and a sinner is not a disbeliever unless he worships others along with Allah (azza wa jal).

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook2Chapter23
data.value: The statement of Allah (azza wa jal): {"If two parties (or groups) from among the believers fall to fighting, then make peace between them both."}4.49

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook2Chapter24
data.value: Zulm (wrong) of one kind can be greater or lesser than that of another.

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook2Chapter26
data.value: To establish prayers on the night of Qadr is a part of faith.

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook2Chapter27
data.value: Al-Jihad (holy war - fighting in Allah's cause) is a part of faith.

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook2Chapter28
data.value: It is a part of faith to establish the (Nawafil - voluntary) prayers during the nights of Ramadan.

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook2Chapter29
data.value: To observe Saum [fasts (according to Islamic teachings)] during the month of Ramadan (sincerely and faithfully) hoping for Allah's rewards only, is a part of faith.

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook2Chapter3
data.value: (What is said) regarding the deeds of faith.

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook2Chapter31
data.value: The (offering of) Salat (Prayers) is a part of faith.

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook2Chapter32
data.value: (What is said regarding the superiority of) a person who embraces Islam sincerely.

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook2Chapter33
data.value: Ad-Din (good righteous deed - act of worship) loved most by Allah (azza wa jal) is that which is done regularly.

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook2Chapter35
data.value: To pay Zakat is a part of Islam.

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook2Chapter36
data.value: To accompany the funeral processions (up to the place of burial) is a part of faith.

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook2Chapter37
data.value: The fear of a believer that his good deeds may be annulled (lost) without his knowledge.

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook2Chapter38
data.value: The asking of (angel) Jibrael (Gabriel) from the Prophet (SAWS) about Belief, Islam, Ihsan (perfection).

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook2Chapter4
data.value: A Muslim is the one who avoids harming Muslims with his tongue and hands.

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook2Chapter40
data.value: The superiority of that person who leaves all doubtful (unclear) things for the sake of his religion.

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook2Chapter41
data.value: To pay Al-Khumus (one-fifth of the war booty to be given in Allah's cause) is a part of faith.

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook2Chapter42
data.value: What is said regarding the statement: 'The reward of deeds depends upon the intention.'

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook2Chapter43
data.value: The statement of the Prophet (SAWS): 'Religion is An-Nasiha [(to be sincere and true) to Allah, to His Messenger, to the Muslim rulers, and to all the Muslims.]'

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook2Chapter5
data.value: Whose Islam is the best (Who is the best Muslim)?

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook2Chapter6
data.value: To feed (others) is a part of Islam.

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook2Chapter7
data.value: To like for one's (Muslim's) brother what one likes for himself is a part of faith.

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook2Chapter8
data.value: To love the Messenger (Muhammad) (SAWS) is a part of faith.

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook32
data.value: Virtues of the Night of Qadr

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook33
data.value: Retiring to a Mosque for Remembrance of Allah (I'tikaf)

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook35
data.value: Sales in which a Price is paid for Goods to be Delivered Later (As-Salam)

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook38
data.value: Transferance of a Debt from One Person to Another (Al-Hawaala)

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook3Chapter11
data.value: The Prophet (SAWS) used to take care of the people in preaching by selecting a suitable time so that they might not run away (or get bored).

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook3Chapter12
data.value: Whoever fixed a special day for giving (a religious talk) to the students.

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook3Chapter13
data.value: If Allah (azza wa jal) wants to do good to a person, He makes him comprehend the religion. [The understanding of the Qur'an and the Sunna (legal ways) of Prophet Muhammad (SAWS)].

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook3Chapter15
data.value: Wish to be like the one who has knowledge and Al-Hikmah (wisdom) [i.e. the knowledge of the Qur'an and the Sunna (legal ways) of the Prophet (SAWS)]. And 'Umar (RA) said: Everyone must acquire sound religious knowledge early before he becomes a chief. (Abu 'Abdullah said: The companions of the Prophet had studied inspite of the fact that they were old in age).

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook3Chapter16
data.value: What has been said about the journey of Prophet Musa ('alaihi as-salam) (when he went) in the sea to meet Al-Khidr.

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook3Chapter17
data.value: The statement of the Prophet (SAWS): 'O Allah! Bestow on hlm (Ibn 'Abbas) the knowledge of the Book (the Qur'an).'

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook3Chapter18
data.value: At what age may youth be listened to (i.e. the quotation of the Hadith from a boy be acceptable).

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook3Chapter19
data.value: To go out in search of knowledge.

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook3Chapter2
data.value: Whoever is asked about knowledge while he is busy in some conversation, so he finished talking and then answered the questioner.

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook3Chapter20
data.value: The superiority of a person who learns (Islam, becomes a religions scholar) and then teaches it to others.

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook3Chapter21
data.value: (What is said regarding) the disappearance of the (religious) knowledge and the appearance of (religious) ignorance.

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook3Chapter23
data.value: To give a religious verdict while riding an animal or standing on anything else.

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook3Chapter24
data.value: Whoever gave a religious verdict by beckoning or by nodding.

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook3Chapter25
data.value: The Prophet (saws) urged the people (mission) of 'Abdul Qais to memorize the faith and the (religious) knowledge (as he explained to them) and to inform (convey) to their people whom they left behind (at home).

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook3Chapter26
data.value: To travel seeking an answer to a problematic matter, and to teach it to one's family.

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook3Chapter27
data.value: To fix the duties in rotation for learning (religious) knowledge.

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook3Chapter28
data.value: To be furious while preaching or teaching if one sees what one hates.

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook3Chapter29
data.value: Whoever knelt down before the Imam or a (religious) preacher.

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook3Chapter3
data.value: Whoever raises his voice in (conveying) knowledge.

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook3Chapter30
data.value: Repeating one's talk thrice in order to make others understand.

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook3Chapter31
data.value: A man teaching (religion to) his woman-slave and his family.

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook3Chapter32
data.value: The preaching (and teaching) of the (religious) knowledge to women by the Imam (chief):

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook3Chapter34
data.value: How the (religious) knowledge will he taken away?

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook3Chapter35
data.value: Should a day be fixed for women in order to teach them religion (apart from men)?

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook3Chapter36
data.value: Whoever heard something (but did not understand it) and then asked again till he understood it completely.

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook3Chapter37
data.value: It is incumbent on those who are present [in a religious meeting (or conference)] to convey the knowledge to those who are absent. (This statement has come from the Prophet (SAWS) upon the authority of Ibn 'Abbas).

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook3Chapter38
data.value: The sin of a person who tells a lie against the Prophet (SAWS).

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook3Chapter4
data.value: Concerning the variety of words used by narrators conveying different significations regarding the concept of narrating and which has importance for the Hadith scholars only.

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook3Chapter40
data.value: The knowledge and its teaching and preaching at night.

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook3Chapter41
data.value: To speak about (religious) knowledge at night.

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook3Chapter42
data.value: (What is said regarding) the memorization of the (religious) knowledge.

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook3Chapter43
data.value: To be quiet (and listen) to religious learned men.

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook3Chapter44
data.value: When a religious learned man is asked. "Who is the most learned person." (It is better for him to attribute or entrust absolute knowledge to Allah (azza wa jal), and to say, "Allah is the Most Learned (than anybody else).")

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook3Chapter45
data.value: Whosoever, while standing, asked a religious learned man who was sitting (on a pulpit or a similar thing, about something).

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook3Chapter46
data.value: To ask about a religious matter and to give a religious verdict (at Mina during Hajj) while doing the Rami of Jimar (throwing of pebbles at the Jimar in Mina during Hajj).

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook3Chapter47
data.value: The Statement of Allah (azza wa jal): "And of knowledge you (mankind) have been given only a little." (V. l7:85).

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook3Chapter48
data.value: Whosoever left some optional things simply for the fear that some people may not be able to understand them and may fall into something more difficult.

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook3Chapter49
data.value: Whoever selected some people to teach them (religious) knowledge preferring them over others for fear that the others may not understand it.

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook3Chapter5
data.value: The Imam questioning his companions in order to test their knowledge.

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook3Chapter50
data.value: (What is said as regards:-) To be shy (Al-Haya') while learning (religious knowledge).

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook3Chapter51
data.value: Whosoever felt shy (to ask something) and then requested another person to ask on his behalf.

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook3Chapter52
data.value: Teaching religious knowledge and giving religious verdicts in a mosque.

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook3Chapter53
data.value: Whosoever answered to the questioner more than what he asked.

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook3Chapter7
data.value: What is said regarding the hand to hand exchange (of books of knowledge), and the writing of knowledge by religious scholars to different countries.

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook3Chapter8
data.value: Whoever sat at the farther end of a gathering. And whoever found a place amongst a gathering and took his seat there.

data.name: IslamInfo_bukhariBook3Chapter9
data.value: The statement of the Prophet (SAWS): 'It is probable that a person who receives a piece of information indirectly may comprehend it better than he who has heard it directly from its source.'

data.name: IslamInfo_EnteringMasjidilHaram
data.value: O Allah! Thou art peace and peace is from Thee! Our Lord! Cause us to live with peace, and cause us to enter The House of Peace. Our Lord, Owner of Honour and Majesty, Thou art most Blessed and Exalted! O Allah! Grant me with Thou blessings and forgiveness, live me in it in the Name of Allah, and all Praise is to Allah, salawat and Salam to our Master Sayyidina Muhammad.

data.name: IslamInfo_FifthCreed
data.value: I seek forgiveness from Allah, my Lord, from every sin I committed knowingly or unknowingly, secretly or openly, and I turn towards Him from the sin that I know and from the sin that I do not know. Certainly You, You (are) the knower of the hidden things and the Concealer (of) the mistakes and the Forgiver (of) the sins. And (there is) no power and no strength except from Allah, the Most High, the Most Great.

data.name: IslamInfo_FifthCreedLabel
data.value: Fifth creed - The word of Penitence (Astaghfar)

data.name: IslamInfo_FourthCreed
data.value: (There is) none worthy of worship except Allah. He is only One. (There is) no partners for Him. For Him (is) the Kingdom. And for Him (is) the Praise. He gives life and causes death. And He (is) Alive. He will not die, never, ever. Possessor of Majesty and Reverence. In His hand (is) the goodness. And He (is) the goodness. And He (is) on everything powerful.

data.name: IslamInfo_IhramPrayerSupplication
data.value: In the name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful! Allah is the greatest, Allah is the greatest, Allah is the greatest, how perfect He is, The One Who has placed this (transport) at our service, and we ourselves would not have been capable of that, and of our Lord is our final destiny. O Allah we ask You for birr and taqwaa(comprehensive terms referring to all good actions and obedience) in this journey of ours, and we ask you for deeds which please You. O Allah, facilitate our journey and let us cover it's distance quickly. O Allah, You are the Companion on the journey and The Successor over the family, O Allah, I take refuge with you from the difficulties of travel, from having a change of hearts and being in a bad predicament, and I take refuge in You from an ill fated out come with wealth and family.

data.name: IslamInfo_IhramPrayerSupplicationWordByWord
data.value: In the name of|Allah|the Most Gracious|the Most Merciful|Allah|is the greatest|Allah|is the greatest|Allah|is the greatest|how perfect|He is|The One Who has placed|this (transport)|and not|we ourselves|of that|would have been capable|and truly|to|our Lord|is our finaly destiny|O Allah|truly|we ask of You for|in|journey|this|birr|and taqwaa|and for|deeds|which|please You|O Allah|help|facilitate|our journey|this|and let us cover it's distance|truly|fast|O Allah|You are|The Companion|on|the journey|and The Successor|over|the family|O Allah|I|take refuge with You|from|the difficulties of|travel|and having a change of hearts|being in a bad predicament|and out come|ill fated|with|wealth|and family

data.name: IslamInfo_InTheEvening1
data.value: We have ended a new day and with it all dominion is Allah's. Praise is to Allah. None has the right to be worshipped but Allah alone, Who has no partner. To Allah belongs the dominion, and to Him is the praise and He is Able to do all things. My Lord, I ask You for the good things of this night and of the nights that come after it, and I seek refuge in You from the evil of this night and of the nights that come after it. My lord, I seek refuge in You from laziness and helpless old age. My Lord, I seek refuge in You from the punishment of Hell-fire, and from the punishment of the grave.

data.name: IslamInfo_InTheEvening1WordByWord
data.value: We have ended a new day|and with it|all dominion|is Allah's.|Praise|is to Allah.|None|has the right to be worshipped|but|Allah|alone,|no|partner|has He.|To Allah|belongs the dominion,|and to Him|is the praise|and He is|upon|all|things|Able to do.|My Lord,|I ask You for|the good things||of|this|night|and|of the nights that come|after it,|and I seek refuge|in You|from|the evil||of|this|night|and|of the nights that come|after it.|My lord,|I seek refuge|in You|from|laziness|and helpless|old age.|My Lord,|I seek refuge|in You|from|the punishment|of|Hell-fire,|and from the punishment|of|the grave.

data.name: IslamInfo_InTheEvening2
data.value: O Allah, You bring us the end of the day as You bring us its beginning, You bring us life and You bring us death, and to You is our fate.

data.name: IslamInfo_InTheEvening2WordByWord
data.value: O Allah,|You|bring us the end of the day|as You|bring us its beginning,|You|bring us life|and You|bring us death,|and to You|is our fate.

data.name: IslamInfo_InTheEvening3
data.value: O Allah, I have ended another day and call upon You and upon the bearers of Your Throne, upon Your angels and all creation to bear witness that surely You are Allah, there is none worthy of worship but You alone, You have no partners, and that Muhammad is Your slave and Your messenger. (Recite four times in Arabic).

data.name: IslamInfo_InTheEvening3WordByWord
data.value: O Allah,||I have ended another day|and call upon You|and upon|the bearers|of Your Throne,|upon Your angels|and all|creation|to bear witness that surely|You|are Allah,|there is none|worthy of worship|but|You|alone,|no|partners|You have,|and that|Muhammad|is Your slave|and Your messenger.

data.name: IslamInfo_InTheEvening4
data.value: O Allah, as I enter this evening whatever blessing has been received by me or anyone of Your creation is from You alone, You have no partner. All praise is for You and thanks is to You.

data.name: IslamInfo_InTheEvening4WordByWord
data.value: O Allah,|as|I enter this evening||whatever|blessing has been received by me|or|anyone|of|Your creation|is from You|alone,|no|partner|You have.|for You|All praise is|and to You|thanks is.

data.name: IslamInfo_InTheEvening5
data.value: We have ended a new day and with it all the dominion which belongs to Allah, Lord of all that exists. O Allah, I ask You for the good things of this night, its victory, its help, its light, its blessings, and its guidance. I seek refuge in You from the evil that is in it and from the evil that follows it.

data.name: IslamInfo_InTheEvening5WordByWord
data.value: We have ended a new day|and with it|all the dominion|which belongs to Allah,|Lord|of all that exists.|O Allah,||I ask You for|the good things|of this|night,|its victory,|its help,|its light,|its blessings,|and its guidance.|I seek refuge|in You|from|the evil|that is|in it|and from the evil|that|follows it.

data.name: IslamInfo_InTheEvening6
data.value: We end this day upon the natural religion of Islam, the word of sincere devotion, the religion of our Prophet Muhammad (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him), and the faith of our father Ibrahim. He was upright (in worshipping Allah), and a Muslim. He was not of those who worship others besides Allah.

data.name: IslamInfo_InTheEvening6WordByWord
data.value: We end this day|upon|the natural religion|of Islam,||the word|of sincere devotion,||the religion|of our Prophet|Muhammad (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him),|and|the faith|of our father|Ibrahim.|He was upright (in worshipping Allah),|and a Muslim.|not|He was|of those|who worship others besides Allah.

data.name: IslamInfo_InTheEvening7
data.value: I seek refuge in the Perfect Words of Allah from the evil of what He has created. (Recite three times in Arabic).

data.name: IslamInfo_InTheEvening7WordByWord
data.value: I seek refuge|in the Words|of Allah|Perfect|from|the evil|of what|He has created.

data.name: IslamInfo_InTheEvening8
data.value: We have risen this evening and sovereignty is all Allah’s. Praise is due to Allah alone, He has no partner, there is no God but Him, unto whom is our fate.

data.name: IslamInfo_InTheEvening8WordByWord
data.value: We have risen this evening|and|sovereignty is all|Allah’s.|Praise is due to|Allah alone,|no|partner|He has,|there is no|God|but|Him,|unto whom|is our fate.

data.name: IslamInfo_InTheEvening9
data.value: O Allah! I rise up in the evening with the blessing, strength, and protection, all of which you have bestowed upon me. Complete your blessing, the strength (you bestowed upon me) and your protection, in this life and the hereafter.

data.name: IslamInfo_InTheEvening9WordByWord
data.value: O Allah!||I rise up in the evening|with|,all of which you have bestowed upon me|the blessing,|strength,|and protection.|Complete|your blessing,|(you bestowed upon me)|the strength|and your protection,|in|this life|and the hereafter.

data.name: IslamInfo_InTheMorning1
data.value: We have entered a new day and with it all dominion is Allah's. Praise is to Allah. None has the right to be worshipped but Allah alone, Who has no partner. To Allah belongs the dominion, and to Him is the praise and He is Able to do all things. My Lord, I ask You for the goodness of this day and of the days that come after it, and I seek refuge in You from the evil of this day and of the days that come after it. My lord, I seek refuge in You from laziness and helpless old age. My Lord, I seek refuge in You from the punishment of Hell-fire, and from the punishment of the grave.

data.name: IslamInfo_InTheMorning1WordByWord
data.value: We have entered a new day|and with it|all dominion|is Allah's.|Praise|is to Allah.|None|has the right to be worshipped|but|Allah|alone,|no|partner|has He.|To Allah|belongs the dominion,|and to Him|is the praise|and He is|upon|all|things|Able to do.|My Lord,|I ask You for|the goodness||of|this|day|and|of the days that come|after it,|and I seek refuge|in You|from|the evil||of|this|day|and|of the days that come|after it.|My lord,|I seek refuge|in You|from|laziness|and helpless|old age.|My Lord,|I seek refuge|in You|from|the punishment|of|Hell-fire,|and from the punishment|of|the grave.

data.name: IslamInfo_InTheMorning2
data.value: O Allah, by You we enter the morning and by You we enter the evening, by You we live and by You we die, and to You is the Final Return.

data.name: IslamInfo_InTheMorning2WordByWord
data.value: O Allah,|by You|we enter the morning|and by You|we enter the evening,|by You|we live|and by You|we die,|and to You|is the Final Return.

data.name: IslamInfo_InTheMorning3
data.value: O Allah, I have entered a new morning and call upon You and upon the bearers of Your Throne, upon Your angels and all creation to bear witness that surely You are Allah, there is none worthy of worship but You alone, You have no partners, and that Muhammad is Your slave and Your messenger. (Recite four times in Arabic).

data.name: IslamInfo_InTheMorning3WordByWord
data.value: O Allah,||I have entered a new morning|and call upon You|and upon|the bearers|of Your Throne,|upon Your angels|and all|creation|to bear witness that surely|You|are Allah,|there is none|worthy of worship|but|You|alone,|no|partners|You have,|and that|Muhammad|is Your slave|and Your messenger.

data.name: IslamInfo_InTheMorning4
data.value: O Allah, as I enter this morning whatever blessing has been received by me or anyone of Your creation is from You alone, You have no partner. All praise is for You and thanks is to You.

data.name: IslamInfo_InTheMorning4WordByWord
data.value: O Allah,|as|I enter this morning||whatever|blessing has been received by me|or|anyone|of|Your creation|is from You|alone,|no|partner|You have.|for You|All praise is|and to You|thanks is.

data.name: IslamInfo_InTheMorning5
data.value: We have entered a new day and with it all the dominion which belongs to Allah, Lord of all that exists. O Allah, I ask You for the goodness of this day, its victory, its help, its light, its blessings, and its guidance. I seek refuge in You from the evil that is in it and from the evil that follows it.

data.name: IslamInfo_InTheMorning5WordByWord
data.value: We have entered a new day|and with it|all the dominion|which belongs to Allah,|Lord|of all that exists.|O Allah,||I ask You for|the goodness|of this|day,|its victory,|its help,|its light,|its blessings,|and its guidance.|I seek refuge|in You|from|the evil|that is|in it|and from the evil|that|follows it.

data.name: IslamInfo_InTheMorning6
data.value: We have entered a new day upon the natural religion of Islam, the word of sincere devotion, the religion of our Prophet Muhammad (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him), and the faith of our father Ibrahim. He was upright (in worshipping Allah), and a Muslim. He was not of those who worship others besides Allah.

data.name: IslamInfo_InTheMorning6WordByWord

data.name: IslamInfo_InTheMorning7
data.value: Glory is to Allah and praise is to Him, by the multitude of His creation, by His Pleasure, by the weight of His Throne, and by the extent of His Words. (Recite three times in Arabic).

data.name: IslamInfo_InTheMorningOrEvening3
data.value: O Allah, You are my Lord, there is none worthy of worship but You. You created me and I am your slave. I keep Your covenant, and my pledge to You so far as I am able, I seek refuge in You from the evil of what I have done, I admit to Your blessings upon me, and I admit to my misdeeds. Forgive me, for there is none who may forgive sins but You.

data.name: IslamInfo_InTheMorningOrEvening3WordByWord

data.name: IslamInfo_InTheMorningOrEvening4
data.value: O Allah, make me healthy in my body. O Allah, preserve for me my hearing. O Allah, preserve for me my sight. There is none worthy of worship but You. O Allah, I seek refuge in You from disbelief and poverty and I seek refuge in You from the punishment of the grave. There is none worthy of worship but You. (Recite three times in Arabic).

data.value: We ask you O that He is Allah who there is no God except He

data.name: IslamInfo_IntroductionFirst
data.value: Verily all praise is for Allah, we praise Him, seek His help and guidance and His forgiveness; and we seek refuge in Allah from the evil of ourselves and from the sinfulness of our actions. Whosoever Allah guides, then none can misguide him, and whosoever Allah misguides, there can be no guide for him. I testify there is no deity worthy of worship except Allah alone, and I testify that Muhammad is His servant and messenger.

data.name: IslamInfo_IntroductionFirstWordByWord

data.name: IslamInfo_IntroductionSecond
data.value: To proceed: Certainly the best speech is the Book of Allah and the finest guidance is the guidance of Muhammad, the prayers of Allah upon him and peace. The most evil affair is a newly invented matter in religion and every newly invented matter is innovation and every innovation is straying and every straying is in the fire.

data.name: IslamInfo_RemembranceFirst
data.value: None has the right to be worshipped but You (O Allah)), Glorified (and Exalted) are You (above all that (evil) they associate with You). Truly, I have been of the wrong-doers.

data.value: O Allah! Exalt and have mercy on Muhammad (peace and blessings upon him), your servant, your Prophet, and your Messenger, and upon his family and companions, and grant them peace.

data.name: IslamInfo_SixthCreed
data.value: O Allah! Certainly I seek protection with You from, that I associate partner with You anything and I know it. And I seek forgiveness from You for that I do not know it. I repented from it and I made myself free from disbelief and polytheism and the falsehood and the back-biting and the innovation and the tell-tales and the bad deeds and the blame and the disobedience, all of them. And I submit and I say (there is) none worthy of worship except Allah, Muhammad is the Messenger of Allah.

data.name: IslamInfo_SixthCreedLabel
data.value: Sixth creed - The words of rejecting disbelief (Rud-A-Kuffer)

data.name: IslamInfo_SupplicationForArrivingAtMakkah
data.value: O God! This sanctuary is Thy Sacred Place; and this Holy City is Thy City; and Peace therin is Thy Peace! Then forbid me from the Hell fire. O God! Save me from Thy punishment on the Day when Thou wilt raise Thy servants.

data.name: IslamInfo_Talbiah
data.value: I have responded to You, My God! I have responded to You, and I proclaim that there is no other God besides You; I have responded to You. For You alone is All The Praise and All The Bounty, and for You alone is The Sovereignty. You have no partners.

data.name: IslamInfo_WhenGoingToTheMosque1
data.value: O Allah, place light in my heart, and on my tongue light, and in my ears light and in my sight light, and above me light and below me light, and to my right light and to my left light, and before me light and behind me light. Place in my soul light. Magnify for me light, and amplify for me light. Make for me light and make me a light. O Allah, grant me light, and place light in my nerves, and in my body light and in my blood light and in my hair light and in my skin light. (O Allah, make for me a light in my grave... and a light in my bones.) (Increase me in light, increase me in light, increase me in light.) (Grant me light upon light.)

data.name: IslamInfo_WhenGoingToTheMosque1WordByWord

data.name: IslamInfo_WhenWakingUp1
data.value: Praise is to Allah Who gives us life after He has caused us to die and to Him is the return.

data.name: IslamInfo_WhenWakingUp1WordByWord
data.value: Praise is|to Allah|Who|gives us life|after||He has caused us to die|and to Him|is the return

data.name: IslamInfo_WhenWakingUp2
data.value: There is none worthy of worship but Allah alone, Who has no partner. His is the dominion and to Him belongs all praise, and He is Able to do all things. Glory is to Allah. Praise is to Allah. There is none worthy of worship but Allah. Allah is the Most Great. There is no might and no power except by Allah's leave, the Exalted, the Mighty. My Lord, forgive me.

data.name: IslamInfo_WhenWakingUp2WordByWord

data.name: IslamInfo_WhenWakingUp3

data.name: IslamInfo_WhenWearingAGarment1

data.value: O Allah, praise is to You. You have clothed me. I ask You for its goodness and the goodness of what it has been made for, and I seek Your protection from the evil of it and the evil of what it has been made for.

data.name: IslamSource_Credits
data.value: Credit for the Arabic Quran text goes to the Tanzil project. Credit for any translations verse by verse for many of them goes to the Tanzil project and for others or the word by word translation then it goes to the respective translator. Credit for the morphological information goes to the Quran Corpus project. Credit for any topic indexes goes to the indexer. Credit for any Quran tafseer translations goes to the translator. Credit for the Arabic hadith collection text goes to Al Eman. Credit for the hadith collection translations goes to each respective translator. Credit for linguistic translations goes to Google Translate. Credit for .NET framework and web administration goes to Microsoft. Credit for MySQL goes to Oracle Corporation. Credit for jQuery goes to The jQuery Foundation. Credit for the jQuery Calenders Datepicker goes to Keith Wood.

data.name: IslamSource_Goal
data.value: This website aims to provide raw source material about Islam including the Quran, hadith collections, books, audio, video, news, vocabulary, transliteration systems and programming information.

data.name: IslamSource_Intro
data.value: Any questions or comments or errors, please email me at:

data.name: IslamSource_SubmissionNote
data.value: Submissions: original source hadith collections must contain an XML metadata file containing all volume, book, chapter and hadith information and an XML file containing the raw hadith text. Translations of hadith collections must provide an XML metadata file containing volume, book, chapter, hadith and mapping to source information and a text file with the hadith data.
